\( \newcommand{\Bra}[1]{\left( #1 \right)} %( #1 ) \newcommand{\BRa}[1]{\left\{#1 \right\}} %{ #1 } \newcommand{\BRA}[1]{\left[ #1 \right]} %[ #1 ] \newcommand{\average}[1]{\left\langle #1\right\rangle} %< #1 > \newcommand{\ket}[1]{| #1 \rangle} %| #1> \newcommand{\bra}[1]{\langle #1|} % < #1| \newcommand{\bracket}[2]{\langle #1 | #2 \rangle} %<#1|#2> \newcommand{\abs}[1]{\right| #1 \left|} \newcommand{\odo}[2]{\frac{d #1}{d #2}} %常微分 \newcommand{\pdo}[2]{\frac{\partial #1}{\partial #2}} %偏微分d#1/d#2 \newcommand{\dint}[2]{\int_{#1}^{#2}} %定積分#1→#2 \newcommand{\1}{\mbox{1}\hspace{-0.25em}\mbox{l}} %白抜きの1 単位行列 \newcommand{\lambdabar}{\lambda \kern -0.5em\raise 0.5ex \hbox{--}} %lambda bar \)

qmap¶

qmap.py

author: Yasutaka Hanada (2013/05/17)

量子系の計算を行います． 具体的には，

  1. 与えられた初期条件の時間発展を行います
  2. 系の時間発展演算子の固有値及び固有ベクトルを求めますよ．

Qmap¶

class SimpleQmap.qmap.Qmap(map, dim, domain)¶

Bases: object

Methods

eigen()¶

return eigenvalues and eigenvectors of time evolution operator matrix

evolve()¶

iteative operation of \(\hat{U}\) for a given initial state

getIn()¶

return previous state of time evolution

getMatrix()¶

return time evolution operator matrix

getOut()¶

return time evolved state

getState()¶

return null state

op0(x)¶

make operator \(\exp[-\frac{i}{\hbar}V(\hat{q})]\)

op1(x)¶

make operator \(\exp[-\frac{i}{\hbar}T(\hat{p})]\)

operate()¶

time evolution of a given state \(|\psi_0\rangle\)

\[\langle q | \psi_1 \rangle = \langle q |\hat{U} | \psi_0 \rangle\]

Note

特に理由がなければ時間発展にはevolve() を使ってください．

pull()¶

substitution time evolved state into previous state

|psi_0 rangle = |psi_1 rangle

setInit(state)¶

set initial state

Parameters:state: State class instance
setMatrix()¶

make time evolution operator matrix in position representation

\[\langle q_1 | \hat{U} | q_0\rangle\]

where

\[\hat{U} = \exp[-\frac{i}{\hbar}T(\hat{p})]\exp[-\frac{i}{\hbar}V(\hat{q})]\]
setOperate()¶

make operators

See also

Module :qmap:Qmap:`op0` and Module :qmap:Qmap:`op1`
